info.title: BUK Store
info.description: This document presents the details of each endpoint used to perform requests in the BUK Store main server.

tags.name: Cart
tags.description: Operation related to the user's cart

tags.name: Reservation
tags.description: Operation related to the user's reservation

get.summary: It retrieves the articles present in one specific page
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the articles present in one specific page

get.summary: It retrieves the books present in the Database
get.description: Use this endpoint to know the books inside the application

get.summary: It retrieves the specified book
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the information about **_ISBN_**

get.summary: It retrieves the authors of the specified book
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the authors' identifiers of **_ISBN_**

get.summary: It retrieves the events related to the specified book
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the identifiers of the events related to **_ISBN_**

get.summary: It retrieves the books similar to the specified book
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the identifier of the books similar to **_ISBN_**

get.summary: It retrieves the reviews of the specified book
get.description: Use this endpoint to download the reviews related to **_ISBN_**

get.summary: Download the most sold books of the Buk Store
get.description: Access to this endpoint to retrieve the identifiers of the book most purchased by the customers

booksSold.description: Qunatity of books solded in the given period

get.summary: It retrieves the events present in the Database
get.description: Use this endpoint to know the scheduled events' identifiers

get.summary: It retrieves the information about the event
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve useful information about **_eventID_**

get.summary: It retrieves the information about the book shown at that event
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the actual book presented during  **_eventID_**

get.summary: It retrieves the authors present in the Database
get.description: Use this endpoint to know the authors' identifiers stored in the application

get.summary: It retrieves the information about a specific author
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve useful information about the author associated to **_authorID_**

get.summary: It retrieves the information about the books written by a specific author
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the identifier of the books written by **_authorID_**

get.summary: Retrieves the books' themes from the Database
get.description: Use this endpoint to know which are the themes identifier inside the application

get.summary: It retrieves the information about the chosen theme
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve information about **_themeID_**

get.summary: It retrieves the information about the books associated to a specific theme
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the identifier of the books associated to **_themeID_**

get.summary: Retrieves the main genres stored in the database
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the main literary genres in the database

get.summary: Retrieves the genres related to the specific main genre
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the genres related to the main genre

parameters.name: mainGenreID
parameters.description: The identifier of the main genre

get.summary: Retrieves the genres of the books stored inside the application
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the genres identifier inside the application

get.summary: Get the information about the desired genre
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve information about **_genreID_**

get.summary: It retrieves the information about the books associated to a specified genre
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the identifier of the books associated to **_genreID_**

get.summary: It retrieves the themes associated to a specific genre
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the identifier of the themes associated to **_genreID_**

post.summary: Endpoint used to register a new user
post.description: Access to this endpoint to register a new user inside the application, passing as body his/her parameters

statusCode.description: The http status code of the request

get.summary: Endpoint used to register a new user
get.description: Access to this endpoint to activate a new user once the user is registered

parameters.name: activationToken
parameters.description: The token sent by email to the user

statusCode.description: The http status code of the request

post.summary: Endpoint used to login inside the Buk Store application
post.description: Pass to this endpoint the email and the password to log in the application after he/she completed the activation phase

token.description: The access token to use the locked endpoints

get.summary: Endpoint used to logout the user
get.description: Use this route to logout a user which is currently logged in the system

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the request made

get.summary: Access to this endpoint to retrieve the user's information
get.description: Make a request to this endpoint to retrieve the information of the user which is actually logged in

put.summary: Access to this endpoint to change the user's information
put.description: Make a request to this endpoint to change the information of the user which is actually logged in

get.summary: Access to this endpoint to retrieve the user's cart
get.description: Send a request here to retrieve the information about the cart of the logged user

post.summary: Add a new book to the user's cart
post.description: Send the book identifier and the quantity to this endpoint in order to add the new book to the cart

put.summary: Change the quantity of the specified book
put.description: Send the book identifier and the new quantity to this endpoint in order to change the number of book inside the user's cart

delete.summary: Delete the specified book from the user's cart
delete.description: Send the book identifier in order to delete that book from the logged in user cart

get.summary: Access to this endpoint to retrieve the user's reservations
get.description: Send a request here to retrieve the information about the reservations of the logged user

post.summary: Create a new reservation starting from the user's cart
post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new order for the user taking the books from his/hers cart

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limit the get response to the given value, default is 5

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Offset the response for pagination purposes, default is 0

title.name: title
title.description: The name of the book to search

pageName.name: pageName
pageName.description: The name of the page from which retrieves the articles

fromDate.name: from
fromDate.description: The date from which the application starts to search, default value is today. Automatically, it is set up the 00**_h_**:00**_m_**:00**_s_** as starting time to search

toDate.name: to
toDate.description: The final date until to search, default value is today. Automatically, it is set up the 23**_h_**:59**_m_**:59**_s_** as final time to search

statusCode.description: The status code of the HTTP error
The status code of the HTTP error

description.example: The user cannot access to this endpoint

statusCode.description: The status code of the HTTP error

description.example: A user with this email already exists inside the Database

statusCode.description: The status code of the HTTP error

description.example: The given parameters are wrong or bad written

statusCode.description: The status code of the HTTP error

MainGenre.description: The object which represents a main genre inside the application

Genre.description: The object which represents a genre inside the application

mainGenre.description: The class of Genre to which this one belongs to

description.example: Thriller is a broad genre of literature, film and television, having numerous, often overlapping subgenres. Thrillers are characterized and defined by the moods they elicit, giving viewers heightened feelings of suspense, excitement, surprise, anticipation and anxiety

picture.description: The path in the server to retrieve the picture representatives of the Genre

Theme.description: The object which represents a theme inside the application

description.example: Crime fiction is a literary genre that fictionalises crimes, their detection, criminals, and their motives. It is usually distinguished from mainstream fiction and other genres such as historical fiction or science fiction, but the boundaries are indistinct.

picture.description: The path in the server to retrieve the picture representatives of the Theme

bio.description: A brief biography of the Author
bio.example: Jol Dicker was born on 16 June 1985 in Geneva, Switzerland. He attended Geneva schools. At the age of 19, he enrolled at the Cours Florent in Paris. After one year he returned to Switzerland to attend law school, where he received his Masters of Law from the University of Geneva in 2010

picture.description: The path in the server to retrieve the picture representatives of the Author

Book.description: The book object which contains all the information about a book

ISBN.description: The id of the book using the EAN convention

title.example: The Truth About the Harry Quebert Affair

picture.description: The path to the book picture

factSheet.description: A summary description of the book
factSheet.example: The Truth About the Harry Quebert Affair is a novel by Swiss author Jol Dicker. It was published in the United States on 27 May 2014, by Penguin Books.[1] The original French version, La vrit sur laffaire Harry Quebert, has sold more than one million copies

abstract.example: The novel is set in a coastal New Hampshire town (called Aurora in the original version and Somerset in the English translation). The protagonist, Marcus Goldman, is a successful young novelist who needs inspiration for his next book. Marcus heads to New Hampshire to stay with his college professor, Harry Quebert, to focus on his writing. When the body of 15-year-old Nola Kellergan is found 33 years after she went missing and Quebert is accused of her murder, Marcus works to uncover the truth. The result of his investigation becomes his next book.

interview.description: A short interview of the book's authors

availableQuantity.description: The amount of books available in the shop

price.description: The price of the book, in euros

genre.title: Genre
genre.description: The most representative elements of a theme

items.title: Theme
items.description: The most representative elements of a theme

Event.description: The object which represents an event of the Buk Store

address.description: The address where the event will take place

eventDate.description: When the event will take place

description.example: Meet the Author Joel Dicker at this event

Review.description: The object which represents a review done by a critic

text.description: The actual text of the review
text.example: For book lovers The Truth About The Harry Quebert Affair is an ideal read as it is a book about a book about a book.  Marcus Goldman, author and protg of the famous author Harry Quebert, is the narrator of this book.  We follow him from having had a very successful debut novel, to having writers block, to writing another bestseller about a murder that happened thirty three years ago and where the main suspect is none other that his friend and mentor Harry Quebert.  What is interesting is that the chapters go backwards, from chapter thirty one  to one  which reflects how the story unfolds, gradually going backwards to find out what really happened to Nola Kellergan.

User.description: The object which represents a user inside the application

userID.description: The identifier of the user in a UUIDv4 format

email.description: The email of the user used to identify him/her

Cart.description: The object which has all the book inside the user's cart

quantity.description: The quantity of the chosen books inside the user's cart

Reservation.description: The object which handles the reservation done by the user

shippingLocation.description: The location where the books will be delivered

arrivalDate.description: When the order will be delivered

GenericPage.description: The object which contains the articles present inside a generic page

articleID.description: The identifier of the article inside the Database

title.example: When my product will be delivered?

text.example: After 7 days starting from the purchase date

postDate.description: The date when the article was inserted in the Database

picture.description: A path of a picture of this article

documentOrder.description: The order in which the articles are presented inside the page
documentOrder.example: When my product will be delivered?

page.description: The title of the page in which the article should be
